column2: MS DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Mississippi
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: sound the horn.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 2. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Merge
column6: Winding Road Ahead

column2: 4. Which of the following road surfaces freezes first when wet?
column4: Bridges and overpasses.
column6: Tunnels.

column2: 5. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 6. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must go straight ahead
column6: A road joins from the right

column2: 8. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: white triangles.
column6: green rectangles.

column2: 9. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Diamond
column6: Arrows

column2: 10. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 11. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 12. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp right turn ahead.
column6: A road joins from the right
column8: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road

column2: 14. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: slow and proceed with caution.
column6: come to a complete stop, then proceed.

column2: 15. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.
column6: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column8: about halfway through the deceleration lane.

column2: 16. A flashing yellow light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 17. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
column4: a deaf person.
column6: a traffic enforcement officer.

column2: 18. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 19. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more slowly
column6: stop much more quickly

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: One Way
column6: Railroad Crossing

column2: 21. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: a speed limit sign.
column6: a crossbuck sign.

column2: 22. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 23. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column6: always stop, whether thereâ€™s a stop sign or not.
column8: always sound their horn and stay alert.

column2: 24. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: following another vehicle.
column6: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column8: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

column2: 25. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 26. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column6: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.
column8: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 27. Bicyclists making a left hand turn:
column4: should wait on the right side of the road.
column6: may use the left lane.

column2: 28. When daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
column4: parking lights.
column6: low beam headlights.

column2: 29. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: can not turn left.
column8: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 30. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.
